ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class is a fantastic choice for Senior Year. The workload is light, the reading is interesting, and you get a chance to reflect and write about your own experiences! Prof Stepto is also amazing.

Excellent, highly recommended.The pace of the class was just right to keep me interested and looking forward to the next lesson.Very knowledgeable, great personality, very passionate, and he just know it all. Instructor was kind and understanding towards students.
Easy class. Easy A. 3 papers (2- 5 pagers and 1 - 10 pager). Read the books.
Yes I would definitely recommend it without reservations.

I would highly recommend this course, as long as you are interested in the topic. Although it might appear as a seminar, there is much more lecture than you might think. But this is balanced by the fact that Professor Stepto is an incredible lecturer, who is intimately familiar with the subject.
A superb class with a diverse, wide-ranging reading list (with a very reasonable one-book-per-week pace). Prof. Stepto is fantastic  an excellent discussion leader and a very nice guy.
YES!! This class and the Professor are amazing. You will work with a man that is dedicated, passionate, and funny. You will not regret taking this course. STEPTO STEPPIN' to the BEAT!
